metadata.title: Predicting Medal Counts In Olympics Using Machine Learning Algorithm
metadata.description: The major international sports that occur once in every four years are Olympics ,has more than 200 participant nations. It is used for preventing whether the Atlantic is too winning a win a medal in the Olympic game . the studies on Olympic are expecting to predict the total number of medals of The nation and possible to achieve further or country’s performance All the country should do analyse to evaluate previous performance so they get to know their mistake and help to grow in the further. Machine learning in particular boosting algorithms, it has an influence it improves in prediction models.
keywords: Olympic game, machine learning algorithm, Olympic medals predication.

metadata.title: Two new species of Penicillium and a new genus in Xylariomycetidae from the forest dump-sites in Chiang Mai, Thailand
metadata.description: Waste accumulation in forest regions can have a severe impact on the soil mycobiome. However, research on soil fungi inhabiting forest disposal sites remains limited. Therefore, this study focused on the taxonomy and phylogeny of ascomycetes isolated from soil in forest dump-sites in Chiang Mai, Thailand. The fungal strains were identified using morphological characterisations and multigene phylogenetic reconstruction. A new genus, Pseudoleptodontidium, typified by Ps. chiangmaiense sp. nov. (Amphisphaeriales genera incertae sedis, Xylariomycetidae), along with two new species, Penicillium chiangmaiense (series Janthinella, section Lanata-Divaricata) and P. terrae (series Erubescentia, section Exilicaulis) (Aspergillaceae, Eurotiales), are described in detail and compared with closely-related species. Our discovery offers valuable insights into the soil ascomycetes associated with forest disturbances.

metadata.title: Machine Learning -Based Stroke Prediction
metadata.description: This study emphasizes the importance of early stroke detection and prevention, highlighting challenges like missing and unbalanced data. It evaluates various machine learning models, including Random Forest and Logistic Regression, using k-fold cross-validation on balanced and imbalanced datasets. Key predictors identified are age, BMI, average blood sugar, and marital status. The Random Forest model achieved the highest accuracy (95.5%), demonstrating the potential of machine learning to enhance stroke prediction and improve patient outcomes.
keywords: Stroke Prediction, Machine Learning, Dense Stacking Ensemble (DSE), Random Forest, Imbalanced Data.
references: 1.	Patel, S. (2022). A deep learning approach for machine learning
2.	Zhang, Y. (n.d.). Machine learning-based models for predicting the risk of stroke.

metadata.title: Fertilizer Recommendation Using Deep Soil Inspection
metadata.description: Conventional fertilizer-appointment systems generally provide a one-stop solution to nutrient management which may not be optimal in different agricultural conditions. This paper proposes an explainable XGBoost-based framework, which considers soil properties, climatic parameters, and crop-specific information to provide precise fertilizer recommendations. A novel contribution is the introduction of SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) for model interpretability to help farmers understand the key drivers of the recommendations. The dataset consisted of 1,200 samples of NPK values, pH, temperature, rainfall, soil color, and crop type, which were preprocessed by standardization and label encoding. Grid-search-based hyperparameter tuning helped in model optimization, achieving 92.3% accuracy on test data as compared to 88.5% for Random Forests and 84.7% for SVMs. SHAP analysis highlighted soil Nitrogen (weight=0.35) and Rainfall (weight=0.18) as the most influential features. A user interface to provide recommendations in real time demonstrated the working of this system. The work brings forward a connection between complex machine learning models and agricultural insight.
keywords: XGBoost, SHAP, precision agriculture, hyperparameter tuning, fertilizer recommendations.
references: 1.	Rani, S., & Kumar, S. (2021). Fertilizer recommendation for precision agriculture using machine learning. Agriculture and Technology Journal, 45(2), 23-38.
2.	Verma, S., & Gupta, R. (2022). Impact of soil and climatic data on crop yield prediction and fertilizer usage. Journal of Agricultural Science and Technology, 30(1), 112-128.
3.	Singh, A., & Sharma, P. (2020). Machine learning models for optimizing fertilizer recommendations: A comprehensive review. Precision Agriculture, 18(4), 495-510.
4.	Patel, H., & Yadav, S. (2023). Data-driven methods for improving fertilizer efficiency in agriculture. International Journal of Sustainable Agriculture, 8(3), 210-225.

metadata.title: Loan Eligibility Prediction Using Machine Learning
metadata.description: Loans are a main source of income for banks. Loan has become an essential for everyone. Loan is given for the one who could re- pay it. To predict this scenario machine learning is used. This makes a way easier to know whether the loan should be granted or not. Predictions here are purely based on a person’s income and his eligibility to pay-back the amount. These models are trained relying on the past datasets. The datasets are available on various platforms such as kaggle. These algorithms have a high accuracy and the outcomes are trustable. In today’s world everybody looks up to how fast the work is going to be done. These are those kinds of emerging technologies which are really helpful to get the results sooner. It also reduces the risk of frauds and financial loses and improves decision- making. It focuses on purifying the data and selection of the attributes. This algorithm includes an additional advantage as it increases the accuracy the time complexity gets reduced. Here, data is partitioned into training and testing parts as model gets trained using train dataset and its performance is evaluated on test dataset. These procedures are complicated and time consuming to do manually. This approach of ML is much easier to convey.

metadata.title: Bankruptcy Prediction Model Under Uncertainty in Indonesia
metadata.description: This paper assesses three issues in predicting of the bankruptcy under uncertainty in the COVID-19 pandemic within the Textile and Garment companies listing in the IDX Stock Exchange. First, it determines the industry characteristics that categorizes potential to bankrupt or non-bankrupt. Second, it identifies predictors as the benchmark model’s that can indicate a company's potential to bankrupt. Third, it assesses the bankruptcy prediction panels are more significant than the benchmark model’s that concerning the financial ratios, firm characteristics, and macroeconomic. Using the panel data for five years within eighteen companies, we found the financial ratios of the listed companies within asymmetric distribution. Overall, the firm characteristics during those periods did not differ but were dominated by the companies that had potential to bankrupt compared to those that were non-bankrupt. The cumulative liquidity and profitability ratios become more potential to reduce probabilities of company categorized bankrupt. However, the profitability and solvability ratios have an effect size on propensity of the listed companies to determine whether they are potential to bankrupt than non-bankrupt. The COVID-19 pandemic as an uncertainty period contributes to increasing the accuracy of predicting the probability of companies that are potentially bankrupt or other types of failures.

metadata.title: Brain Tumor Prediction with Machine Learning
metadata.description: This review aims to systematically analyze ML models from four aspects: The investigation is based on the nurture of the ML technique, estimation precision, model evolution, and estimation setting. The systematic literature review of empirical studies focused on the published articles on ML models of the last decades. From the above sources, fifty-one primary studies concerning the objective of this research were identified on analyzing these studies; five ML techniques have been using it in the classification and prediction of brain tumors. the accuracies achieved by the estimated ML models can be consistories satisfactory, as they either match or surpass those of non-3fL models. The phenomenon of using improved machine learning models to classify and predict brain tumors him been the subject of numerous studies. Accenting to the mutters of the corresponding words, the genetic algorithm achieve‹t the highest level of prediction accuracy more than 10 among null the models that were tried. However, because of their complexity, these 3fL models have not yet been adopted by the industry and thus need more development.
keywords: Brain Turner; Machine Learning; Prediction, Medical Imaging; Classification, Neurul Networks; Computer Aided Diagnosis Early Detection
references: 1.	American Cancer Society. (2021). Cancer facts & figures 2021.

metadata.title: An Overview of Machine Learning Techniques for Diagnosing Diseases
metadata.description:
Abstract:

 These days, machine learning algorithms are crucial to the medical field, particularly when it comes to using medical databases to diagnose illnesses. Many companies utilize these techniques for the early prediction of diseases and enhance medical diagnostics. This paper aims to provide an overview of machine learning algorithms, including Naïve Bayes, logistic regression, support vector machines, K-nearest neighbor, K-means clustering, decision trees, and random forests, that are used for the identification and prediction of numerous diseases. Numerous earlier studies that employed machine learning algorithms to identify different disorders in the medical field over the last three years were reviewed in this paper. Regarding these algorithms, evaluation procedures, and the outcomes, a comparison is given. Lastly, a review of the earlier works is given.

creators.name: Waykole, Rashmi
creators.affiliation: Department of Computer Science S.D Arts, V.S Apte Commerce, M.H Mehta Science College, Palghar

keywords: Keywords: -Disease Diagnostics, Machine Learning, Classification Algorithm.

journal.title: International Journal of Advance and Applied Research

metadata.title: Smart Parking Solutions: A Review of Emerging Technologies and Challenges for Sustainable Smart Cities
metadata.description: The rapid urbanization of cities has led to significant challenges in transportation management, particularly in smart parking and traffic congestion. Traditional methods of parking space management and traffic monitoring are inefficient, leading to increased fuel consumption, pollution, and driver frustration. Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Deep Learning (DL) have emerged as powerful solutions to enhance efficiency, optimize resource allocation, and improve real-time monitoring. These intelligent systems utilize Internet of Things (IoT) sensors, convolutional neural networks (CNNs), reinforcement learning, and computer vision techniques to automate parking detection, traffic flow prediction, and congestion management. AI-powered smart parking systems provide real-time insights into parking availability, reducing search times and optimizing space utilization. Similarly, deep learning-based traffic management techniques enable predictive analytics for congestion control, anomaly detection, and automated traffic signal adjustments. Various AI-based models have demonstrated high accuracy in vehicle detection, parking space prediction, and real-time traffic analysis. However, challenges such as high computational costs, data privacy concerns, scalability issues, and real-time implementation constraints still hinder widespread adoption. This paper reviews recent advancements in AI-driven smart parking systems, deep learning-based vehicle detection, and intelligent transportation systems. A detailed analysis of existing literature is provided, highlighting key technologies, methodologies, and their effectiveness in real-world applications. Furthermore, the paper discusses the limitations of current approaches and identifies areas requiring further research. Finally, future research directions are discussed to improve the accuracy, efficiency, and scalability of AI-based intelligent transportation systems, ensuring sustainable and smarter urban mobility solutions.
keywords: Smart Parking, Deep Learning, AI, IoT, Traffic Management
references: 1.	Aditya, A., et al. (2023). An IoT-assisted intelligent parking system (IPS) for smart cities. Procedia Computer Science, 218, 1045–1054. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.procs.2022.12.156

2.	Alymani, M., Almoqhem, L. A., Alabdulwahab, D. A., Alghamdi, A. A., Alshahrani, H., & Raza, K. (2025). Enabling smart parking for smart cities using Internet of Things (IoT) and machine learning. PeerJ Computer Science, 11, e2544. https://doi.org/10.7717/peerj-cs.2544
